titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Amelia Trial and Adam Eisler.
titlestmt.sponsor: This finding aid was prepared with generous support from

address.addressline: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Amelia Trial and Adam Eisler in March 2010.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to [children's literature and associated artwork, nursing education and leadership, literature, various aspects of Connecticut history, the experiences of Connecticut residents while in the military, alternative lifestyles, politics and publications, Connecticut labor, Connecticut nursing education, New England railroad, Connecticut business records, Connecticut's ethnic communities, Connecticut's flora, fauna and environment, Connecticut politics, the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students, etc.]. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], [Collection title]. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

note.p: Correspondence regarding speaking engagements at various Historical Societies broken down by state. These states include Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island and Vermont. Other correspondence includes travel arrangements, grant proposals and workshops. There is also correspondence with the AASLH including candidates nominated, awards recieved and general committee communication.
This box contains files listed alphabetically A-C

did.unittitle: Correspondence with individuals with last name begining with A. Correspondence with Historical societies begining with A, inquiring information about Jonathan Trumbull and Abbreviations used in printing.
American Antiquarian Society. Inventory of collection with attention to Jonathan Trumbull papers.
Analysis of Jonathan Trumbull papers by Van Dusen

Analysis of Trumbull papers from Various archives and libraries including the Connecticut archives and the colonial war archives. These files also contain rules and regulations for documentary editing.
Correspondece with various individuals, historical societies and libraries about any Jonathan Trumbull papers.
Correspondence about Trumbull papers and an announcement for a public auction on November 5, 1975 where Trumbull items were auctioned off.
Outline of Volume one of Jonathan Trumbull papers, including letters to and from Trumbull, notebooks and sermons. Also chronology of Trumbull's life, 1710-1766.
bindery instructions. Also a request for Van Dusen to submit Jonathan Trumbull project plans to BINET.
Information about Trumbull House. Biographical information about Van Dusen requested by various magazines.
Correspondence with historical societies and libraries about Trumbull papers.

note.p: This box contains correspondence between Van Dusen and various Historical societies, libraries and colleges about trumbull papers in the U.S as well as Europe. Also there are records of grant proposals and grants recieved for the Jonathan Trumbull project.

The first half of the box is correspondence with various historical societies and libraires reguarding Trumbull papers. Also records reguarding the Trumbull papers project funding.The second half of the box contains printings, works cited and indexes from Van Dusen's book Connecticutpublished in 1961. Also the book The Public Records of the State of Connecticut May 1800-October 1801 By Albert and Wilda Van Dusen published 1965. This is not a bound copy and the book is broken down into sections, including appendixes, which are also continued into the next box.

This box contains illustration credits, indexs,radom house captions and four incomplete copies of Van Dusen's book Connecticut. Also a copy of Albert and Wilda Van Dusen's book The Public Records of the State of Connecticut May 1800-October 1801. There are two copies of copies of Connecticut records used in this publication. Pictures, newspaper clippings and few photocopied documents on Jonathan Trumbull are also in this box.The last part of the box contins personal papers from Dusen's teaching years at The University of Connecticut. Included is a syllabus for each class, grades, student evaluations, papers, student correspondence and exam sheets.

Classes taught by Van Dusen including a syllabus for each class, grades, student evaluations, student papers and exam sheets. This box also contains papers about Samuel Russell and company used for the paper written by Van Dusen entitled Samuel Russell and the China Trade 1818-1831. History department meetings with minutes, correspondence with AASLH regarding grant proposals and multiple folders on the NAMES committeeas well as the Oral History advisory committee.

Box of note cards (some hand written some typed)Broken down into several sections including Biography, general works, local, manuscripts, account books, monographs, newpapers/periodicals, printed sources, travel, tercentenary publications/pamphlets and a large section on middletown. All other cards are mostly from and about Connecticut with a few others from other New England areas.

Photostatic copies of correspondence, legal documents and legislative materials associated with Jonathan Trumbull are arranged chronologically within large envelopes. Envelopes may also contain photocopies and transcriptions. Manuscript notations by Van Dusen occasionally recorded on envelopes.
Correspondents include CT delegates, Benedict Arnold, and John Hancock.
Correspondents include John Hancock and General George Washington regarding impending trial.
General correspondence plus letters to General Assembly regarding manufacturing of Sulphur (May), Naval Officers (May), procuring money (May), sending militia, exc.
A document entitled "James Austins Confessions on illicit trade (November 29, 1781) received folder note by Van Dusen

Collection of Van Dusen's notes on Jonathan Trumbull's sermons from 1724 to 1785. Photocopies of the transcripts are included. Examples in collection include J.T's reflections on becoming a minister followed by notes by Van Dusen. J.T's commonplace book followed by notes from Van Dusen. Correspondence, letters, ledgers, account books, J.T's confession of faith. a "Free Status Certificate" for a slave, and J.T's "Mulatto Girl Grace.

did.unitdate: 1752 - 1755 (1744 was added towards end of the set)

note.p: misc. correspondence and items including General Assembly Response to the Albany Plan of Union.
Misc. correspondence and inventories concerning foodstuffs and merchandise
Misc correspondence and notes. Box contains some duplicates.

The label on the original box reads Rel-Town TKT (N.H). This box contains a samll part of a very large index. The entire index is typed in a list and is located in the front of the box. The box goes from religion to towns.

Lable on the Origianl box reads Bibligraphy Connecticut cards. This is a typed up list of Dusen's Book Connceticut each individual source used in the book is typed on its own note card. There are some note cards that are labled omitted from final draft and are placed at the back.

Box containing information about the life of Samuel Huntingtonof Norwich, Connecticut. Includes Huntington's correspondence between 1731-1796, information about his family house in scotland. Also Van Dusen's correspondence with various historical societies and libraries looking for information about Huntington.
The label on this box reads, Connecticut State Libraries towns A-N. The box contains information on town celebrations, famous individuals and information on churches.
The label on this box reads, Connecticut State Libraries towns O-Z. The box contains information on town celebrations, famous individuals and information on churches.

The Label on the box readsHartford CourantandHartford Times There is a note card in the front of the box listing all other newspapers used including the BridgeportTimes-starThe MeridenRecord The New HavenRegister The New LondonDayThe StamfordAdvocate The TorringtonRegisterand the WaterburgRepublicanThe two main categories in this box are politics and economics, each with several sub sections.

The label on this box reads Index A. This box contains an index used for a book or a series of articles listed A-Y. It contains a list of people and towns (mostly Connecticut) with several cards about Jonathan Trumbull.
This box contains Note Cards on Connecticut including sections on religion, politics, foreign correspondence between various individuals. Many cards have theHartford Courantas a source.

This box contains information on the 1914-1922 elections. The note cards are broken down into several sections including WWI, Womens suffrage, state legislation, politics, prohibition, Ku Klux Klan, book burning and labor.
Information on Politics (1800-1935). most sources from theHartford Courantand theHartford Times
Note cards with information on politics(between 1936-~1962) most sources from theHartford Courant

Corresondense between Van Dusen and various musuems including committee meetings, staff meetings(for Uconn) invitations to various events, newsletters, newspaper clippings and personal letters between friends. This box also contains notes on the entire first draft of the playWith Sword and Palette: A Spectacle Drama on Patriot-Artist John Turmbull Also letters of correspondce between Samuel Russell and various individuals (a great deal with his brother A.E Russell) for the paperSamuel Russell and the China Trade, 1818-1831 The last part of the box contains personal information about Wilda's past including diplomas, old school work, replys to her and Albert's wedding invitations, old pictures, dress patterns and an article in the Durham Morning Herald announcing Wilda and Albert's wedding with a picture of Wilda in her wedding gown.
Photostats of Conn. Archives, Rev War: volume 28 (part 1,2), 29, 30, 25 (part 2). Washington Papers microfilm reel 33, 34. (typed and original list)

Microprints of John Trumbull Papers from New Hampshire Records and Archives (further identification on back of each microprint). Photostats of Conn. Archives Rev War-- first series vol. 25, 33 (part 1). (typed and original list included)
Phototstats of Conn. Archives, Rev. War: colonial vol. 7 (part 2). 1758 (part 2) (typed and original list included)
"cardboards 2"
"cardboards 3"
"cardboards 4"

Photostats of Connecticut Colonial Official Trumbull Papers (1631 - 1784), vol. 30. Letterbook (1766-1771). Photostats of Conn. Archives, Rev. War Series 1, vol. 31, Cart 1: Soldiers, vessels, letters, grievances. Microcopies of the George Washington Papers, reel 39, 38 (August 29 - November 30, 1776 (original list plus further identification on back of each microcopy)
"Historical Magazine items copied" - votes for November (1780). Vol XXIX TP 1776 - 1777

Microcopies of the National Archives, Roll 80: copies of the continental congress 1774 - 1789, Connecticut State copies 1775 - 1779, vol. 2 (title page include, original list included with vol. 1). Microcopies of the National Archives 247, Roll 80, copies of Continental Congress 1774 - 1789, Connecticut State copies 1775 - 1789, vol. 1 (duplicates although one appears to be handwritten and the other typed).
Photostats of Connecticut Archives Revolutionary War. Vol. 23, 1782 records (photocopied list of dated documents).

Photocopies of microprints of Trumbull Documents from the national archive. Entitled "complete reel to be copied"-- further identification of each frame on front of each copy, no original list included, numerical order of each frame listed only. Microcopies of the National Archives "microcopy 247", roll 24, items 14, 15, 16; copies of Continental Congress 1774 - 1789 (notes and original list included). Microcopies of the Papers Of Eleazer Wheelock, reel 1,2,3,8,9,10,11: June 18, 1755 - June 3, 1776 (typed document identification and original list). Microcopies of Public Record Office- War Office: V34:28, 1758 - 1763 (Copies not in numerical order but in the order as listed on original list)
Box contains photocopies of Connecticut Colonial Office, Trumbull copies vol. 28, 27, 26. Letter noted to be pre-1769. Letter book 1 (1775 - 1778), 2 (1778 - 1779), and 3 (1753 - 1775).

Connecticut Archives First Series - Misc. vol. 3, Cart 2 1685 - 1789 (original and typed list). Connecticut Archives photocopies series 2, vol 3 and 4. Goup of zerozed copies of items from Yale library (Trumbull related documents). Photostats from Massachusets Historical Society (original list). PRO material from Connecticut Historical Society relating to Glen Curgenven (check spelling) and New Haven customers. Connecticut Historical Society, Ames, Almanac, Lebanon survey notes. Connecticut Archives "Colonial Wars" vol. 5 pt. 1 and 2. Horse Guards Charter. Photostats from CT Archives: Insolvent Debtors vol. 1 (1762 - 1787), civil offices vol. 2 (1725 - 1742), colleges and schools series 1 (1661 - 1789), finances and currency vol. 2 (1725 - 1737), colonial boundaries vol. 3 (1670 - 1827), crimes misdeameanors series 1, vol. 4 (1737 - 1755), finances and currency series 1, vol. 5 (1764 - 1789), foreign correspondence vol. 1, cart 2 (1663 - 1748). Colonial War vol. 4, pt. 2, vol. 10, part 1.

Microprints of George Washinton Papers series 4: reel 41 (April - May 1777), 42 (30 May 1777 - 22 July 1777), 45 (26 October 1777 - 3 December 1777), 44 (4 September 1777 - 24 October 1777), 43 (23 July 1777 - 3 September 1777).

Connecticut Archives: First Series (militia) vol 4 (1747 - 1752), vol 5 (1752 - 1757), vol 2 (1730 - 1740), vol 3 cart 1 (1635 - 1789). Second Series vol 55 (1770 - 1856), vol 56 (1774 - 1834), vol 16 (1784 - 1788), vol 6 (1769). Third Series vol 3 (1728 - 1790). Trumbull Papers vol 12, cart 2 (1631 - 1784..1780). Trade and Maritime vol 1, cart 2 first series (1668 - 1789). Connecticut Archives 1st series, ecclesiastical vol 6 (1737 - 1742) and vol 7 (1742 - 1745). Colonial Wars vol 6 (1675 - 1775) and vol 7. 1st series (travel) vol 3 (1770 - 1788). Towns and Lauds vol 8- cart 1 (1629 - 1789), vol 7- cart 1 and 2, vol 3 (1742 - 1754), vol 5 (1763), vol 9. Microcopy of reel 16 (Henry Capers) June 22, 1779. Connecticut Colonial Office: Trumbull Capers vol 4, cart 2 (1631 - 1784). Capers of Continental Congress. Capers relating to claims of territory for Pennsylvania and Connecticut, Continental Congress (microcopy 247, roll no. 89). Henry Capres 1777 - 1779, roll 7 and 9. Microcopy 247, roll 23 (letterbooks of president of congress September 15, 1775 and December 8, 1778). Washington Capers vol. 10, 11, 12, 7, 8, 9, 10. Trumbull documents from National Archives. Photocopies of Trumbull documents

General Correspondence between Trumbull and associates. Photocopied, typed, and handwritten transcripts included. Dates in box are out of order: first set ends on 12 October 1763, second begins on 7 December 1763 and goes through 1764.
General correspondence, court cases, summons, etc. Dates also slightly out of order.
Correspondence, sermon notes, deeds, commonplace books, records, notes on court cases, exc.
correspondence, random documents (school covenant, receipts, General Assembly reports).

Begins with packet containing information and biographies on notable colonial figures. Assembled alphabetically beginning with A (Ethan Allen, Samuel Adams, exc.). Boxes also includes items of interest and background not related to Trumbull, various documents (photostats) under the title "documents for editing", and correspondence both unrelated and related to J. Trumbull.

did.unitdate: Date range is as early as 1759 and as late as 1789.

note.p: Correspondence, "act book" containing records of purchases and inventory list, and confessions of faith. Box also includes two large black ledges entitled "Led I 1757 - 1771" and "Led A 1759 - 1774"
Correspondence, manuscripts (typed and photocopied) of Trumbull's sermons and sermon notes. Box also includes bills of change and account books.
Photostat copies of misc. papers. Microfilm copies of presidential papers (George Washington Papers), French and Indian War documents, items from Trumbull Papers Collections
Correspondence and two rolled up photostats.
Contains ledges E, F, F duplicate, and G.
Ledgers.
Spanish Ship Case Papers (photostats), Spanish Case misc. problems (correspondence, Trumbull report to General Assembly concerning Spanish Ship Case).
Correspondence.
Photostats from Connecticut Archives - Revolutionary War First Series. Content similiar to that of boxes 59 - 64.
Library budget request, folders containing budget and finance documents, annual reports, exc.
Personal possessions: catalogs, magazines, newspaper clippings, misc. papers.
Financial papers and typed letters concerning funding of Trumbull Papers Project. Funding and research proposals.
Collection of Bicentennial Series "American Revolution Bicentennial Comission" booklets: 1 - 35, 8 and 11 are missing.
Misc. papers including: notes, letters, table of contents from Trumbull Papers. Bundles of notecards with notes and addresses on them. Folders containing pictures, notes, photocopies.
Trumbull correspondence (typed transcripts and photocopies)
Correspondence (photostats and photocopies)
Correspondence. Dates are out of order.
Correspondence
Correspondence, confessions of faith, lebanon school covenant, exc.
Court cases, summons, probate court.

did.unitdate: Dates include: September 1755 - 7 June 1771 - 3 September 1755 - 25 May 1758.

note.p: Correspondence, probate court cases, summons, genereal assembly matters, acts, motions, and misc. documents.

did.unitdate: Dates include: 19 June 1759, 11 Dec 1759, 12 January 1760 - 4 August 1760

note.p: Correspondence (typed, photostats, photocopies, transcripts, notes)
Summons, orders of payment, correspondence, Trumbull sermon notes.
Trumbull sermon notes, commonplace book, correspondence, journal notes, general notes.

Lebanon church records, proprietors record book, mohegan case documents, records. misc. photocopies of letters. photocopied excerpts from "the currency of the American colonies". records from ecclesiastical society and lebanon congregational church. photocopies of publications on Lebanon, CT.
Correspondence marked "unedited"

did.unitdate: Dates include: 1752, 1752 - 1769. 1, 16 January, 18 Febuary, 10, 20, 24 and March 1751/52. 13 April 1752 - 30 August 1755.

note.p: "unedited correspondence"
Correspondence, bills, General Assembly matters. Photocopies and photostats. Spanish ship case documents. Unedited documents. Sasquehammack Case and papers. Housing plans.
Photocopied and typed transcripts of letters and documents. Original copy/manuscript of book entitled "Connecticut". Copy of Van Dusen's "Connecticut".
Trumbull correspondence and photocopies of Trumbull history and documents.
Correspondence with various musuems, historical societies, colleges, committees and associations. Book reviews as well as annoucement for Van Dusen's retiring from Uconn (1983)

Student work as well as graded student work. Correspondence with students. Class papers; old exam sheets, syllabus for each class, field trips, reading assingments, study abroad pamphlets. Also material on grant proposals.

classes taught by Van Dusen including syllabi, reading lists, field trips possibly graded student work. Newspaper clippings, grant information and correspondence with museums and historical societies. Various information on the Trumbull papers including publication information on the frist volume of the Trumbull papers. Correspondence with the AASLH including nominations and awards.
This box contains Jonathan Trumbull documents. Some are undated, others are labeled that Van Dusen did not use them. Some are labeled 1790-1829. Also the Commonplace book of Jonathan Trumbull

Personal items and papers of Van Dusen including catalogs, letters, invitations, postcards, Connecticut papers. Photoduplication policies/procedures for various U.S. libraries. Van Dusen correspondence, real estate info, office memos, and various historical articles. Staff concerns regarding Trumbull Papers. Report on ledgers E and F of Trumbull (Box 74). Personal service agreements and other papers regarding the Trumbull Papers Project. Photostats and photocopies of historical documents.

photocopies and photostats of Trumbull diary (1759 - 1760) (carbon copy included) and account book (1759 - 1762). Trumbull correspondence ( 29 June 1761 - 12 September 1761). Publications about Mystic and maritime history. One book on the Third Reich. Notecards on Lebanon Church Records vol. II. Biographical notecards.
Section of file collections beginning with Nathaniel Greene and ending on the letter R. Information on libraries and people, projects, archives.
Letters, personal notebooks, yearbooks, examinations, and personal items of Albert Van Dusen's wife. Much of the material in this box
Final copy of xeroxes of Trumbull sermon notes, correspondence (Van Dusen handwritten notes included)
Photocopies of handwritten notes on Trumbull and correspondence between Trumbull and associates.
UConn files 1970 - 1977 concerning graduate school, intradepartmental notices, newsletters, exc.
Xeroxes of historical documents, correspondence, and pages from ledger. Ledger G.
Correspondence, Albany Plan of Union.
Trumbull correspondence
Trumbull's reflections on becoming a minister, notes and support, draft for articles of consideration, correspondence between listed dates, list of armies.

did.unitdate: Dates include: April/May 1764, June/July - December 1752, July/September 1756. October/November 1756, Febuary 1757, July/September 1755, 1754, October/December 1763, January - March 1764, 1775 - 1776, 1767 - 1773, 1778 - 1791, 1804 - 1809, 1744 - 1755, 1758, 1760 - 1763, 1744 - 1763

note.p: Trumbull correspondence with notes, record book, inventory list, Joseph Trumbull Papers, Norwich Town Records, Connecticut Historical Society (Hadly), French and Indian War Papers, David Trumbull Papers.

Collection of postcards from Van Dusen, original typescripts (1739 - 1749), photostat copies of historical documents, Van Dusen personal letters, 1729 - 1749 manuscript typed by Van Dusen for Trumbull Papers, biographical photocopies.
Photostats of General Assmebly papers,

Documents from Yale (1767 - 1822) including 1772 Yale commencement. Lebanon map 1769 - 1779. Pension files. National Archives files. Joseph Trumbull's probate files. Correspondence (September 1776 - April 1780)
Spanish ship case (7 October 1754 - March 1756). Nova Scotia papers (8 December 1760 - 19 June 1769). Correspondence (1759 - 1766).

Documents on Trumbull house and family. Biographical material on historical figures and deeds. Harvard faculty records. Land holdings, records, deeds and misc. items. Three black notebooks containing manuscripts of Trumbull papers and correspondence.
General Gage to Governor Trumbull. Misc. notes. History of Trumbull papers. Assorted publications from UConn. *Box needs review for extraneous and unncessary material*

Informational packets on microfilm process including catalogs and manuals. Microfilm project for Trumbull project including grant applications and information. Abstracts and proposals for Trumbull project. Time cards reporting hours worked at state library by assistants of Van Dusen (potential for removal).

Assorted photocopies of historical papers: Narragansett Historical Register, papers on emigration and settlement of Nova Scotia, Historical Register, Diary of Jabez Fitch. Photostats, maps, and notecards.
Photocopies of articles on colonial figures- last names beginning with F - L.
Photocopies of articles on colonial figures- L-S
Various correspondence with organizations. Information on Jonathan Trumbull paper including annual and quarterly reports on the progress of the project. Book reviews by Van Dusen
Box reads: Index puritans Against the Wilderness A-Z. All hand written, possibly for a book or article.

Information on various towns in connecitcut and various correspondence. A large part of this box contians Van Dusen's book Commonplace all typed all chapters in own individual folders. Also includes footnotes. Van Dusen's academic and non academic activities (1964-67)

Various correspondence including correspondence about Jonathan Trumbull papers. Information about Van Dusen being the Connecticut state historian. More personal information such as travel plans and plans for retirement.
Various correspondence including correspondence about Jonathan Trumbull papers. A large amount of correspondence with the Antiquarian and Landmarks society.
Manuscript of Trumbull notes on becoming a minister (original typescript 1724 - January 1738/39). Revised grant application. AVD files. Photostats of documents and notes.
Booklets/historical magazines, interviews, photostats. *Box needs review for extraneous and unncessary material*

Various correspondence including to with the AASLH about awards. Correspondence regarding Jonathan Trumbull papers. Personal correspondence with friends as well as a large section about Van and Wilda's travels (including travel arrangements, expenses,menus and maps. Correspondence with the connecticut Judicial department
Personal letters to Wilda and Van from friends. Also invitations and newspaper clippings

Folders relevant to Van Dusen's career as a historian. Folders are in alphabetical order and contain everything from lecture guides, CHS and other historical society newsletters, graduate student publications, history of Trumbull papers

Notecards on lectures given by Van Dusen, information on American Colonial History, newspaper clippings, photographic transparencies, library/archives request documents, research notecards. *Box needs review for extraneous and unncessary material*
Folders containing Van Dusen correspondence (largely between 1970-72), lecture/speech matierals, pictures,

Various correspondence including with the AASLH about nominies. There is also announcemnt of an award for distiction for Van presented by the AASLH. Also correspondence reguarding the Trumbull papers. Van's travel logs and planners from 1962-1973 are also included. Also some of Van's medical records.

Various historical reports done by Van Dusen, miscellaneous correspondence and some photocopied material on Jonathan Trumbull. Also a copy of Van's book Puritains against the Wilderness: CT history to 1763 copyright 1975. Correspondence with library commission and various awards given to Van Dusen

Correspondence, cards (at this time Van Dusen is already physically not well), information on Reep family, class record books containing names and grades, newspaper clippings on Van Dusen speeches, pictures. *Box needs review for extraneous and unncessary material*

Estate information (items in house were appraised), meeting minutes and notices, correspondence, newsletters from comittees/societies, publications, and evaluations. Material from Van Dusen's teaching days.

Personal correspondence (1983-860. Paper reviews, talks given by Van Dusen. Various correspondence including correspondence with AASLH and regarding Jonathan Trumbull papers. Big folder on caner. Cancer articles and pamphlets. Also Wilda's medical record of having brest cancer

This box contains various stacks of note cards from various boxes of Van Dusen's personal and professional boxes. Some contain bibliographical information on Jonathan Trumbull (two sets of these, one hand written the other typed.)Also cards with notes and quotes on them dealing with colonial tradein late 17th and early 18th centuries. Next set contains information on Norwich CT (mostly people and places). Miscellaneous photograph as well as a whole stack of note cards with the sources crossed off.

Several sections of note cards are in this box. Sections include; research slips, various libraries, random references, biog. search file, editing(ideas), bibliography of Trbl books, inter-library loan, journals of cont. congress. Many if not all sources having to do with Jonathan Trumbull.

Box says, Library-state of CT 30 oak street. Hartford. A-H. Although not identified, this is a list of people only living in late 1600's and 1700's-early 1800's. Most if not all of these people are from CT.

Front of the box reads Accession No. file 2300-4699. Cards are all typed and numbered 2300-4699 and are bibliographical information on wether a particular source was to, from or about Jonathan Trumbull
This is a continuation of box 146. This box is I-Z and contains the same information as box 146.

Front of the box reads Maritime CT. Box contains index A-W. Based on title of the box and content, this box appears to be about CT maritime activities. Ships trading, whaling and also cards on Europe(possibly trading). Not marked what project they are for but in the front there are a few pictures of what looks like Wilda and Van skiing.
Box says chron file 1764-75. Note cards are grouped by year so the card numbers are all out of order. All of them are about Jonathan Trumbull, either to, from or about him.

(This is a big box with three rows of note cards and each row will need individual box when new boxes arrive but the next three boxes are all from the same original box labeled File #2 A.E. Van Dusen). First row is from Neal-Sarah (all typed). All about Jonathan Trumbull broken down into towns, subjects and people about documents to, from and about Jonathan Trumbull.
This box is the continuation of box 151. It goes from Sarah-Ga-JT, Bus. Act. 1754.
This is a continuation from box 152. It goes from JT, Bus. Act, 1775-Younghusband.
Box is labeled 1771-. Note cards are alphabetical from A-I. They are of people who grew up in Connecticut, where they ended up and what occupation if known (mostly if not all males).

Card in front of the box describes the content. It is Connecticut bibliography. A selected list of material in the Connectiuct state library dealing with the state. Items are arranged alphabetically by author with general subjects in red at the top of the card.
Box reads Town (N.L)-WWII. There is a card in the front of the box listing all the sections (there are nearly 100) all having to do with CT. There is also a large section on CT towns.
Box contains bibliographical information (for an unidentified project) mostly of men and a few women from CT. Alphabetically D-H.

Box contains information on location and what documents different places have on Jonathan Trumbull. Plances include Penn archives, Mass. Historical society, CHS card catalogue, Yale and Rhode Island records.

Cardboard tubes filled with rolled up certificates, genealogical trees of historical figures, awards, retirement notice. Box containing casette tapes and film about history of CT from prehistoric times onwards. Manila envelope containing transcript of interviews with James Barnett along with tapes. Pictures of Van Duse. *Marked for preservation of some materials within*
History department newsletters, newspaper articles on Van Dusen, essay by Wilda Reep, misc. correspondence, retirement certificate
All typed (A-I) regarding Jonathan Trumbull documents (bibliographical information) about letters to, from and about Jonathan Trumbull as well as places concerning J.Trumbull(General Assembly).

All typed (U-Z). All regarding J. Trumbull. Bibliographical notes all about letters to, from and about J.Trumbull. Most of the box is named old accession numbers (half the box contains different set of note cards) where it also has to do with J.Trumbull but it is in numerical order rather than Alphabetical by last name.

All typed. First half of the box is in numerical order, second half is in chronological order (1775-60) of when written (not duplicates in same box). All are note cards have to do with letters to, from and about Jonathan Trumbull.
All about J. Trumbull. Bibliographical information (1776-1778).
Box reads, Ledger index(H-S). Bibliographical information of people listed Alphabetically by last name. Most people from CT.
Same information as box 165, just second half of index (T-Y).
First in index order to boxes 165 and 166 but this contains index (A-G). Same information and a note card in the front of box listing the few exceptions to people in this series.
Box reads Ledger and ACCTS Huntington-Porter, Noah. Listed in alphabetical order by last name. Contains bibliographical information of people, mostly from CT.
Box reads, Ledgers, ACCT books "B-Cutting, Thos." This is a continuation of previous box.
Graduate student information (their doctoral progress), information/notes on lectures, courses, colleagues, publicity,
Newspaper clippings, course notes/guides, correspondence (heavy emphasis on correspondence related to royalites and finances). *Box needs review for extraneous and unnecessary material*

Newsletters/items from various historical societies that Van Dusen was a part of, some financial information is present *marked for removal under the titled "public serviceS"*, manila envelopes containing information on Van Dusen's foster child in Italy (numerous folders entitled Domenico)

Typescript of "Puritans against the Wilderness" and a page proof. Many folders with information and writings on the Pequots. Chapters divided into folders from "Puritans against the Wilderness" on Pequot Press.

Notecards containing notes on historical figures, events, and places (most likely for lectures and speeches). Budgetary papers. Correspondence, abstract, drafts, and chapers for dissertation (?). Folder marked "Courant" was removed for preservation.

Van Dusen correspondence *marked for review*. Two small boxes filled with notecards: one contains information on events and figures between the years 1800 and 1801 gathed from various Connecticut news publications mainly Connecticut Courant and Am. Mercury. The other contains notes on elections 1924, 1926, 1928 and politics of that time. Personal papers of Van Dusen and records of Trumbull correspondence with small notes on content.
Misc. papers (photocopies, letters) *marked for review* in no immediate order or arrangement. Newsletters. Wilda's correspondence in box arranged alphabetically. Diary.
Framed awards given to Van Dusen over the span of his career.

*Marked for review*- Date planners, financial information, and other personal items. In addition to these items there is the original picture of a Connecticut house used by Van Dusen for his book "Connecticut" sent to him by Random House Inc.

Folders containing information on research at Sterlin Memorial Library and the Library of Congress organized into respective folders. Many notecards presumably on documents read at the libraries (in no particular arrangement).

*Marked for review* Personal items of Wilda (reunion information, cards, exc), various committee newsletters, government papers, army papers. Two black ledgers containing copy of "Connecticut" in final stage with pictures and everthing else. Manuscripts of "Connecticut" and "John Trumbull's Commonplace book". Correspondence (job offers and other information).

Photostats of Trumbull documents, Maritime documents, and photocopies/photostats of correspondence and other historical documents. *Marked for review: items of research interest should be organized better and placed earlier in the collection with other relevant documents*. Some items have been removed from original box for preservation (pictures). Personal papers.
Misc. papers (kept in folders). Correspondence ranging from 1956 - 1980+. Local societies/committees newsletters and documents. Lecture notes, graduate school letters, and other personal papers.
Pictures (contained in Kodax boxes) used in Van Dusen's "Connecticut". Rolled up photostats of Trumbull letters. Paintings (?). Trumbull correspondence. *Marked for preservation*
Illustration negatives (used in "Connecticut". Misc. Van Dusen correspondnece (not arranged). Condolence cards and letters sent to Wilda after Van Dusen's death.
